Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
UI
public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements UI
Graphical User Interface for the Client.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.Object busyLock
    Lock that allows only one message at a time to be processed by the GUI.
    private GameView currentGame
    The GameView that represents the current state of the Game.
    private java.lang.String id
    The nickname chosen by the user.
    private java.io.ObjectInputStream input
    InputStream for inputs from the server.
    private GUIManager manager
    The manager for this GUI instance.
    private java.util.concurrent.SynchronousQueue<java.lang.Object> messageQueue
    Internal queue for inputs from the user.
    private java.io.ObjectOutputStream output
    OutputStream for outputs to the server.
    private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean running
    Set to true on start and false on stop.
    private java.net.Socket server
    Socket for server communications.
    private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<ToClientMessage> serverQueue
    Queue for all incoming messages from the server.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Allows GUI to run until the Game is over. Handles the connection of the client to the server and opens a communication channel between them. If an IOException or a ClassCastException occur while opening that channel, CLI stops. Creates a messageQueue where, thanks to the GUIManager, the client's input will be offered. Creates a serverQueue where the messages from the server will be put after deserialization. Starts two threads which respectively allows the GUIManager to listen to the client input, and the GUI to listen to the server messages. Every time a message from the server is put on the serverQueue, it is parsed to the corresponding action.
      Specified by:
      run in interface UI

    • serverListener

      public void serverListener()
      Continuously listens to the server. When deserializing a message, puts it on the serverQueue so that it can be processed. If the deserialized message is a Ping from the server, replies with a Pong.
      Specified by:
      serverListener in interface UI

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Closes the communication channel with the server and closes the client.
      Specified by:
      stop in interface UI

    • getServerIp

      public java.lang.String getServerIp()
      Allows receiving from the client the IP of the server he wants to connect to. Calls the getServerIp method on the GUIManager so that it will ask the player to insert the Server IP Address. The GUIManager will put the client's input on the messageQueue and
      Specified by:
      getServerIp in interface UI
      Returns:
      the String written by the client

    • parseMessage

      public void parseMessage​(ToClientMessage message)
      Allows parsing a message received from the server to the corresponding action to do on the client.
      Specified by:
      parseMessage in interface UI
      Parameters:
      message - the ToClientMessage to parse

    • getBoolean

      public boolean getBoolean()
      Takes a message previously put on the messageQueue by the GUIManager. If no exception occurs in taking the message and casting it to a Boolean, that Boolean is returned. If an InterruptedException occurs during serialization, the client is notified there was an error getting his input.
      Returns:
      the Boolean taken from the messageQueue

    • getInteger

      public int getInteger()
      Takes a message previously put on the messageQueue by the GUIManager. If no exception occurs in taking the message and casting it to an Integer, that Integer is returned. If an InterruptedException occurs during serialization, the client is notified there was an error getting his input.
      Returns:
      the Integer taken from the messageQueue

    • getIntegers

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getIntegers()
      Takes a message previously put on the messageQueue by the GUIManager. If no exception occurs in taking the message and casting it to an ArrayList of Integer, that ArrayList it is returned. If an InterruptedException occurs during serialization, the client is notified there was an error getting his input.
      Returns:
      the ArrayList of Integers taken from the messageQueue

    • getString

      public java.lang.String getString()
      Takes a message previously put on the messageQueue by the GUIManager. If no exception occurs in taking the message and casting it to a String, that String it is returned. If an InterruptedException occurs during serialization, the client is notified there was an error getting his input.
      Returns:
      the String taken from the messageQueue

    • pong

      public void pong()
      Creates a new message (Pong Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.

    • sendBoolean

      public void sendBoolean​(boolean body)
      Creates a new message (SendBoolean Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.
      Specified by:
      sendBoolean in interface UI
      Parameters:
      body - the boolean to send to the server in the SendBoolean Message

    • sendInteger

      public void sendInteger​(int body)
      Creates a new message (SendInteger Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.
      Specified by:
      sendInteger in interface UI
      Parameters:
      body - the int to send to the server in the SendInteger Message

    • sendIntegers

      public void sendIntegers​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> body)
      Creates a new message (SendIntegers Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.
      Specified by:
      sendIntegers in interface UI
      Parameters:
      body - the ArrayList of Integers to send to the server in the SendIntegers Message

    • sendString

      public void sendString​(java.lang.String body)
      Creates a new message (SendString Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the server. If an IOException occurs during serialization, the client is notified the server disconnected.
      Specified by:
      sendString in interface UI
      Parameters:
      body - the String to send to the server in the SendString Message

    • chooseCards

      public void chooseCards​(java.util.ArrayList<CardView> possibleCards, int num, java.util.ArrayList<CardView> pickedCards)
      Allows the Player to choose some Cards between those available. He could be asked to choose the 2 or 3 Cards to be used in a 2 or 3-players Game, or his own Card for the Game. Thanks to the GUIManager, the question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseCards in interface UI
      Parameters:
      possibleCards - an ArrayList containing all the available Cards
      num - the number of Cards to choose
      pickedCards - an ArrayList containing all the already picked Cards

    • chooseGameName

      public void chooseGameName​(boolean taken)
      Allows the Player to choose a Game name (max 12 characters and not duplicated). Thanks to the GUIManager, the question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseGameName in interface UI
      Parameters:
      taken - if the previously chosen Game name is already taken, false otherwise

    • chooseGameRoom

      public void chooseGameRoom​(java.util.ArrayList<GameView> gameRooms)
      Allows the Player to choose a Game room. The available Game rooms are displayed on screen; the Player can go back to start a new Game, refresh the list or choose a Game room. Thanks to the GUIManager, the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseGameRoom in interface UI
      Parameters:
      gameRooms - an ArrayList of GameViews containing all the Game Rooms

    • chooseNickname

      public void chooseNickname​(boolean taken)
      Allows the Player to choose a nickname (max 12 characters and not duplicated). Thanks to the GUIManager, the question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseNickname in interface UI
      Parameters:
      taken - true if the previously chosen nickname is already taken, false otherwise

    • choosePlayersNumber

      public void choosePlayersNumber()
      Allows the Player to choose the number of Players (2 or 3) for the Game he is creating. Thanks to the GUIManager, the question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      choosePlayersNumber in interface UI

    • choosePosition

      public void choosePosition​(java.util.ArrayList<CellView> positions, java.lang.String desc)
      Allows the Player to choose a position between those available. Thanks to the GUIManager, the question and the reason of the choice are displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      choosePosition in interface UI
      Parameters:
      positions - an ArrayList containing CellViews representing all the available positions
      desc - the reason of the choice

    • chooseStartingPlayer

      public void chooseStartingPlayer​(java.util.ArrayList<PlayerView> players)
      Allows the Player to choose the starting Player. Thanks to the GUIManager, the question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseStartingPlayer in interface UI
      Parameters:
      players - an ArrayList of PlayerViews representing all the Players involved in the Game

    • chooseStartJoin

      public void chooseStartJoin()
      Allows the Player to choose between starting a new Game or joining an existing one. Thanks to the GUIManager, the question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseStartJoin in interface UI

    • chooseYesNo

      public void chooseYesNo​(java.lang.String query)
      Allows the Player to answer to a "yes or no question". Thanks to the GUIManager, the question is displayed on screen; the input provided by the client is processed and sent to the Server.
      Specified by:
      chooseYesNo in interface UI
      Parameters:
      query - the "yes or no question" asked to the Player

    • displayBuild

      public void displayBuild​(CellView buildPosition, CardView godCard)
      Thanks to the GUIManager, allows displaying the build occurred during a turn. Updates the current GameView to save the new state of the Game.
      Specified by:
      displayBuild in interface UI
      Parameters:
      buildPosition - the CellView representing the position of the building
      godCard - the CardView representing the God Card which eventually allowed this build

    • displayGameInfo

      public void displayGameInfo​(GameView game, java.lang.String desc)
      Thanks to the GUIManager, allows displaying an information about the Game. Updates the current GameView to save the new state of the Game.
      Specified by:
      displayGameInfo in interface UI
      Parameters:
      game - the GameView representing the current state of the Game
      desc - the information

    • displayMessage

      public void displayMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Thanks to the GUIManager, allows displaying a message from the server.
      Specified by:
      displayMessage in interface UI
      Parameters:
      message - the message to display

    • displayMove

      public void displayMove​(java.util.HashMap<CellView,​CellView> moves, CardView godCard)
      Thanks to the GUIManager, allows displaying the move occurred during a turn. Updates the current GameView to save the new state of the Game.
      Specified by:
      displayMove in interface UI
      Parameters:
      moves - an HashMap containing pairs of (starting position, final position) for each worker who moved or was forced to move
      godCard - the CardView representing the God Card which eventually allowed this move

    • displayPlaceWorker

      public void displayPlaceWorker​(CellView position)
      Thanks to the GUIManager, allows displaying the starting position of a Worker. Updates the current GameView to save the new state of the Game.
      Specified by:
      displayPlaceWorker in interface UI
      Parameters:
      position - the starting position of a Worker

      notifyDisconnection in interface UI
      Parameters:
      player - the PlayerView representing the Player who disconnected

    • notifyLoss

      public void notifyLoss​(java.lang.String reason, PlayerView winner)
      Thanks to the GUIManager, allows notifying a Player that he lost, by showing a message on screen reporting his loss and the reason of it.
      Specified by:
      notifyLoss in interface UI
      Parameters:
      reason - the reason of the loss
      winner - the PlayerView representing the Player who eventually won, can be null

      Specified by:
      notifyWin in interface UI
